name: src/bus/Bus.js
remove
description: Remove this listener from the Bus

unknown.tagValue:
micaelpedrosa@gmail.com
Minimal interface and implementation to send and receive messages. It can be reused in many type of components.
Components that need a message system should receive this class as a dependency or extend it.
Extensions should implement the following private methods: _onPostMessage and _registerExternalListener

name: addListener
description:
Register listener to receive message when "msg.to === url".
Special url "*" for default listener is accepted to intercept all messages.

params.name: url
params.description: Address to intercept, tha is in the message "to"

params.name: listener
params.description: listener

name: addResponseListener
description:
Manually add a response listener. Only one listener per message ID should exist.
ATENTION, there is no timeout for this listener.
The listener should be removed with a removeResponseListener, failing to do this will result in a unreleased memory problem.

params.name: url
params.description: Origin address of the message sent, "msg.from".

params.name: msgId
params.description: Message ID that is returned from the postMessage.

params.name: responseListener
params.description: Callback function for the response

params.name: url
params.description: Origin address of the message sent, "msg.from".

params.name: msgId
params.description: Message ID that is returned from the postMessage

name: removeAllListenersOf
description: Remove all existent listeners for the URL

params.name: url
params.description: Address registered

name: bind
description: Helper method to bind listeners (in both directions) into other MiniBus target.

params.name: outUrl
params.description: Outbound URL, register listener for url in direction "this -> target"

params.name: inUrl
params.description: Inbound URL, register listener for url in direction "target -> this"

params.name: target
params.description: The other target MiniBus

return.description: an object that contains the properties [thisListener, targetListener] and the unbind method.

name: postMessage
description:
Send messages to local listeners, or if not exists to external listeners.
It's has an optional mechanism for automatic management of response handlers.
The response handler will be unregistered after receiving the response, or after response timeout (default to 3s).

params.name: msg
params.description: Message to send. Message ID is automatically added to the message.

params.name: responseCallback
params.description: Optional parameter, if the developer what's automatic response management.

return.description: Returns the message ID, in case it should be needed for manual management of the response handler.

name: postMessageWithRetries
description: Function to post messages with a number of retries in case timeouts occur.

params.name: msg
params.description: Message to send. Message ID is automatically added to the message.

params.name: responseCallback
params.description: Optional parameter, if the developer what's automatic response management.

params.name: retries
params.description: number of retries when timeouts occur

name: _onPostMessage
description:
Not public available, used by the class extension implementation, to process messages from the public "postMessage" without a registered listener.
Used to send the message to an external interface, like a WebWorker, IFrame, etc.

params.name: msg
params.description: Message

name: _registerExternalListener
description:
Not public available, used by the class extension implementation, to process all messages that enter the MiniBus from an external interface, like a WebWorker, IFrame, etc.
This method is called one time in the constructor to register external listeners.
The implementation will probably call the "_onMessage" method to publish in the local listeners.
DO NOT call "postMessage", there is a danger that the message enters in a cycle!

name: src/bus/MessageBus.js

unknown.tagValue:
micaelpedrosa@gmail.com
Message BUS Interface is an extension of the Bus
It doesn't support the default '*' listener, instead it uses the registry.resolve(..)

name: postMessage
description:
Post a message for routing. It will first search for a listener, if there is no one, it sends to a external routing using the _onPostMessage.
External routing use the registry.resolve(..) method to decide the destination sandbox.

params.name: inMsg
params.description: JSON with mandatory Message structure {id, type, from, to}

params.name: responseCallback
params.description: Optional callback if a response is expected from the request. A response will be always sent, even if it is a "Timeout".

name: addPublish
description:
Adds an external publish address listener. Every message for the address will be forwarded to the external routing by _onPostMessage.
This means, even if there is a listener for the address, it will also send the message to the external routing.

params.name: from
params.description: Publish address.

name: addForward
description: Adds a forward listener for a message destination. Every message reaching an address will be also sent to the forward address.

params.name: from
params.description: Message destination, it's actually the field "to" of the message.

params.name: to
params.description: Forward address.

name: forward
description: Just forward's a message to the forward address. Listeners should be available for the forward address.

params.name: url
params.description: Forward address.

params.name: msg
params.description: Message to forward

name: src/bus/MiniBus.js

unknown.tagValue:
micaelpedrosa@gmail.com
Message BUS Interface is an extension of the Bus
It is used mainly in the internal sandbox routing.

name: postMessage
description: Post a message for routing. Message is routed directly to the external routing _onPostMessage.

params.name: inMsg
params.description: JSON with mandatory Message structure {id, type, from, to}

params.name: responseCallback
params.description: Optional callback if a response is expected from the request. A response will be always sent, even if it is a "Timeout".

name: src/bus/Pipeline.js

unknown.tagValue:
micaelpedrosa@gmail.com
Wrapper around a message that adds actions that can be fired by any interceptor handler.
The Pipeline is asynchronous, so an handler should always call an action, the default one is "next()"

name: next
description: Proceed to the next interceptor handler, unless there was an error. If it's the last one, proceed to onDeliver handler.

name: deliver
description: Proceed directly to the onDeliver handler, unless there was an error.

name: fail
description: Mark the context with an error and proceed to the onFail handler.

params.name: error
params.description: [description]

unknown.tagValue:
micaelpedrosa@gmail.com
Sequencial processor of methods. Similar to how Sequential Promise's work, but better fit for message processing.
Normal use for this, is to intercept all messages with configured handlers, and act accordingly.

name: process
description: Insert a message in the pipeline queue. All messages are wrapped with a PipeContext.

params.name: msg
params.description: Message for the queue

params.name: onDeliver
params.description: When message is finished processing from all handlers, it will be delivered in this callback.
